name: Stefanie Müller 0001
content: Stefanie Mueller | MIT CSAIL Skip to main content PI Core/Dual Stefanie Mueller Associate Professor Email stefanie.mueller@mit.edu Phone 715-5831 Room 32-211 Stefanie Mueller is the TIBCO Career Development Associate Professor in the MIT EECS department and a member of the Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory. In her research, she develops novel hardware and software systems that advance personal fabrication technologies. Stefanie publishes her work at the most selective HCI venues CHI and UIST and has received several best paper and honorable mention awards. Stefanie was named a Forbes 30 under 30, an MIT Technology Review Innovator under 35 (TR35), and has received a Sloan Fellowship, Microsoft Research Fellowship and NSF CAREER Award. Stefanie has served as both an ACM CHI 2023 paper chair as well as an ACM UIST 2020 paper chair. Stefanie has been an invited speaker at universities and research labs, such as Harvard, Stanford, UC Berkeley, CMU, Microsoft Research, Disney Research, and Adobe Research. Stefanie directs the HCI Engineering group at CSAIL and is actively recruiting Postdocs, PhD students, and interns interested in helping to kickstart this new lab. Interested Postdocs can email her directly. For a PhD position please apply through MIT's PhD admission page. Stefanie Mueller Leads Stefanie Mueller Research Areas AI & ML Graphics & Vision Human-Computer Interaction Robotics Impact Areas Manufacturing Stefanie Mueller Project G-ID: Identifying 3D Prints Using Slicing Parameters HCI Engineering Group G-ID is a method that utilizes the subtle patterns left by the 3D printing process to distinguish and identify objects that otherwise look similar to the naked eye.
